column4: I'm running firefox 3.0.11 in this ubuntu box is there a way to update to 3.5
Bing0: not yet
Bing0: not yetcd ..
Where what?
add jaunty-proposed repository   but where
Synaptic is one way.
!repositories
!patience | Elvaron
Did you manage to find it?
in third party software tab
Yes. Did you add it?
tell me the line I have to add please... if you don't ind again
deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ jaunty-proposed main multiverse restricted universe
Careful, after enabling the repository and upgrading, you will upgrade any "proposed" packages. These are not yet certified fit for release.
There are some extra steps you can take to only upgrade firefox (/etc/apt/preferences)
better to leave it if it's so difficult to
Can a mod edit the bot message for ff35 to indicate that ff35 can be obtained by adding jaunty-proposed?
it will update automatically I guess with time
Yes. But if you want it now then that is the way to do it.
It is not *very* complicated but if you feel uncomfortable doing those steps then I suggest you wait.
3.0.11 it's not bad isn't it?
No it isn't. Javascript is noticeably faster on firefox-3.5 though.
